entry.question:
**Sambhava-parvan 39.1 a-b** *एष देवगणो राजन्कीर्तितस्तेऽनुपूर्वशः ||३९||*
Who is described as the "deva-gana" (celestial assembly) in this verse?
A) Śalya B) Bṛhaspati C) Indra D) Viśvāmitra
entry.answer: B) Bṛhaspati • The verse refers to Bṛhaspati (Jupiter) as the "deva-gana" (celestial assembly). • Śalya and Indra are warriors, not celestial assemblies. • Viśvāmitra is a sage, not a deva-gana.

entry.question:
**Sambhava-parvan 40.1 a-b** *ब्रह्मणो हृदयं भित्त्वा निःसृतो भगवान्भृगुः | भृगोः पुत्रः कविर्विद्वाञ्शुक्रः कविसुतो ग्रहः ||४०||*
Who was born from Brahma's heart according to this verse?
A) Bṛhaspati B) Bṛhgu C) Śukra D) Viśvāmitra
entry.answer: B) Bṛhgu • The verse explicitly states Bṛhgu was born from Brahma's heart. • Śukra is Bṛhgu's son, not the one born from Brahma. • Bṛhaspati and Viśvāmitra are unrelated here.

entry.question:
**Sambhava-parvan 44.1 a-b** *च्यवनं दीप्ततपसं धर्मात्मानं मनीषिणम् | यः स रोषाच्च्युतो गर्भान्मातुर्मोक्षाय भारत ||४४||*
Who was cast out of his mother's womb due to anger?
A) Chyavana B) Rama C) Kṛṣṇa D) Bhīma
entry.answer: A) Chyavana • The verse names Chyavana as the one expelled from his mother's womb. • Rama and Kṛṣṇa are later figures; Bhīma is a Pāṇḍava. • Chyavana is a sage, not a warrior.

entry.question:
**Sambhava-parvan 47.1 a-b** *रामस्तेषां जघन्योऽभूदजघन्यैर्गुणैर्युतः | सर्वशस्त्रास्त्रकुशलः क्षत्रियान्तकरो वशी ||४७||*
Who is described as the "lowest among them" but skilled in all weapons?
A) Rama B) Kṛṣṇa C) Bhīma D) Arjuna
entry.answer: A) Rama • The verse refers to Rama as the "lowest" (jaghanya) but a master of arms. • Kṛṣṇa and Arjuna are later figures; Bhīma is a Pāṇḍava. • Rama's humility is a key theme in the Mahābhārata.

entry.question:
**Sambhava-parvan 67.1 a-b** *अश्वत्थामा महावीर्यः शत्रुपक्षक्षयङ्करः | वीरः कमलपत्राक्षः क्षितावासीन्नराधिप ||६७||*
Who is described as the "destroyer of the enemy's forces" and "lotus-eyed"?
A) Ashvatthama B) Kṛṣṇa C) Bhīma D) Duryodhana
entry.answer: A) Ashvatthama • Ashvatthama is the warrior known for destroying the Kaurava forces. • Kṛṣṇa and Bhīma are allies; Duryodhana is the enemy. • "Lotus-eyed" (kamalapatrikṣa) is a common epithet for Ashvatthama.

**Sankhatalopakhyana 9.1 a-b** *शकुन्तलोवाच||* *गतः पिता मे भगवान्फलान्याहर्तुमाश्रमात् | मुहूर्तं सम्प्रतीक्षस्व द्रक्ष्यस्येनमिहागतम् ||९||*
Who said, "My father has gone to fetch fruits; wait a moment"?
A) Shakuntala B) Dushyanta C) Kṛṣṇa D) Rama
entry.answer: A) Shakuntala • Shakuntala is the speaker, addressing Dushyanta. • Dushyanta is her husband; Kṛṣṇa and Rama are unrelated. • The context is the legendary meeting of Shakuntala and Dushyanta.

Who is described as "the most excellent" and "beautiful-faced"?
A) Shakuntala B) Dushyanta C) Kṛṣṇa D) Rama
entry.answer: A) Shakuntala • The verse describes Shakuntala as "varārohā" (most excellent) and "āruhā" (beautiful). • Dushyanta is her husband; Kṛṣṇa and Rama are unrelated. • The context is her encounter with Dushyanta.
